  "title": "Operations Manager",
  "description": "Elvaridah Limited - Our client, an oil and gas company, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Department: Projects and Technology
Reports To: Operations Director

Position Summary


	Our client in the Oil and Gas sector is seeking an experienced and results-driven Operations Manager to oversee multiple engineering projects and manage project-engineering teams.
	The ideal candidate will have over 10 years of relevant experience in the oil and gas industry, with strong leadership skills, extensive technical knowledge, and the ability to deliver projects on time, within scope, and within budget.
	This role will ensure project objectives are met while maintaining compliance with industry standards and company policies.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead the planning, execution, and delivery of multiple projects simultaneously.
	Develop project strategies, set goals, and define key performance indicators (KPIs) for project success.
	Supervise and mentor a team of Project Engineers, ensuring effective resource allocation and performance management.
	Foster a culture of collaboration, continuous improvement, and accountability within the project team.
	Develop comprehensive project plans, including timelines, budgets, resource allocation, and risk management strategies.
	Ensure adherence to project schedules, budgets, and quality standards.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, understanding their needs and ensuring project alignment with expectations.
	Represent the Company at client meetings, industry events, and stakeholder briefings.
	Oversee project budgets, manage financial risks, and ensure cost-effective resource utilization.
	Identify project risks early and develop mitigation strategies.
	Manage project issues effectively, facilitating timely resolutions to maintain project momentum.
	Ensure projects comply with applicable codes, industry best practices, and company policies.
	Implement quality control procedures to maintain high standards of project deliverables.
	Provide required technical leadership on all engineering and field operations
	Oversee technical reviews and ensure engineering solutions meet project and client requirements.
	Manage relationships with vendors, contractors, and third-party consultants.
	Review contracts, ensure compliance with terms, and oversee procurement processes.
	Develop project performance frameworks, track key metrics, and report regularly to senior management.
	Conduct post-project evaluations to capture lessons learned and improve future project execution.
	Perform other responsibilities as assigned by senior management to support the organization&rsquo;s strategic goals.


Qualifications &amp; Skills


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in engineering (Petroleum, Mechanical, Electrical, Geology or other related field)
	Minimum of 10 years of relevant experience in the oil and gas industry, with at least 5 years in a project management role.
	Proven track record of successfully managing multiple complex projects in the oil and gas sector.
	Strong leadership, team management, and mentoring skills.
	In-depth knowledge of project management methodologies, budgeting, and scheduling.
	Strong knowledge of seismic data acquisition and processing techniques
	Proficient in design and project management software (e.g. MS Project, Primavera, AutoCAD).
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and stakeholder management skills.
	Strong problem-solving abilities and decision-making skills.
	Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment with tight deadlines.
	Willingness to travel to project sites as needed.
	Professional certification in project management (PMP, PRINCE2) is highly desirable.
	Advanced degree (MBA or Master&#39;s in Engineering) is an advantage.
	Strong understanding of HSE regulations and industry best practices.


Work Location / Conditions:


	Office environment with frequent field/site visits.
	May require extended working hours to meet project deadlines.
	Ability to work under pressure in dynamic project environments.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to:&nbsp;careers@elvaridah.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Contact Center Agent Job at Kennedia Consulting Limited




        
    

        
        Kennedia Consulting Limited (KCL) is dedicated to connecting top talent with the right opportunities. We specialize in sourcing skilled professionals across various industries, ensuring seamless hiring solutions for businesses. Our commitment to excellence, efficiency, and integrity makes us a trusted partner in workforce solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Contact Center Agent

Job Location: Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Contract

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a dedicated and professional Contact Centre Agent to join our team. In this role, you will serve as the primary point of contact for customers, addressing inquiries, resolving issues, and ensuring a seamless customer experience.


Responsibilities


	Handle inbound and outbound customer interactions efficiently and professionally.
	Address customer inquiries, resolve complaints, and provide accurate information about products and services.
	Maintain detailed and accurate records of customer interactions in the CRM system.
	Identify and escalate complex issues to the appropriate department for resolution.
	Collaborate with team members to achieve individual and team performance goals


Requirements


	Minimum of a BSc Degree
	Must have completed NYSC
	Fluent in Hausa (added advantage)
	Strong verbal and written communication skills.
	Not older than 26 as at the time of application
	Proven ability to deliver excellent customer service in a professional environment.


Salary
N101,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: recruiterkcl@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Product Manager Job at the Moment




        
    

        
        Moment - Africa is at the cusp of an economic revolution. 1.5 billion people are embracing electronic payments, mobile everything, and racing towards a digital transformation that will change the world for the next two decades. While Internet- and banking-penetration have come late to Africa, a youth-driven tidal wave of change is hitting the continent, and global businesses and local champions are in a race to unlock its potential.

In partnership with Multichoice, the largest entertainment platform on the African continent, we are building a payment platform as ambitious as the customers we serve. 
This is truly the Moment for Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Product Manager
     

            
    



Job Location: Lagos

Responsibilities


	Identify and prioritize payment partners across Africa that align with our strategic growth objectives.
	Conduct technical assessments of payment providers prior to contracting.
	Create and maintain the payment integration roadmap, managing priorities and backlog.
	Build and optimize products across Core Banking, Card Acquiring and Issuing, Bank Transfers, Virtual Accounts, and Alternative Payments.
	Design integration solutions that maximize business value, user experience, and operational efficiency.
	Lead the integration development process from the product side, collaborating closely with engineering and partner teams.
	Deliver successful integrations to market, ensuring performance, reliability, and compliance standards are met.
	Stay ahead of global payment trends and translate them into actionable strategies in the African context.
	Build and maintain strong partnerships


Requirements


	Deep understanding of the Nigerian online and in-person payments ecosystem, including banks, PSPs, wallets, switching networks, merchant acquiring, and card schemes.
	6+ years of product management experience in payments, fintech, or financial services, with a track record of delivering complex integrations.
	Experience building or scaling payments infrastructure across rails such as Core Banking, Cards (issuing & acquiring), Bank Transfers, Virtual Accounts, and Alternative Payments.
	Strong technical knowledge of payment APIs, transaction flows, settlement processes, and fraud/risk considerations.
	Experience working closely with partners (banks, PSPs, fintechs) to drive adoption, improve retention, and resolve integration issues.
	Strong analytical and prioritization skills with a data-driven mindset.
	Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to work across countries and cultures.
	Experience in other African markets and/or exposure to global payment trends is a plus.


Benefits


	Competitive salary
	Equity-based incentives
	Comprehensive health, dental, and vision benefits for you and your family
	Opportunities for career advancement and professional development
	Dynamic and collaborative work environment with passionate team members
